name: 米亚·威尔克森
name_full: 米亚·威尔克森 Mea Wilkerson
introduction: Kwamea Wilkerson, known as Mea Wilkerson, is an American triple threat. Born in Brooklyn, New York and raised in Raleigh, NC; Dedrea Vinson, her single parent mom, supported Mea's desire in the arts by bringing her to dance classes, rehearsals, and auditions. At the age of 19, Mea won her first award as The Best Female Actress in a Leading Role for the Musical, "Mirandy & Brother Wind." At the age of 19 Mea also moved to New York by herself to purse her career in acting. Mea has co-stared in "Hairspray" as Lil Inez and began to work on TV series such as "Internet Ruined My Life" on SYFY and "BrainChild" on Netflix. Mea then moved to Los Angeles at the age of 23 continuing to work in her field of acting and studying at The United Kingdom's Leading Part-Time Drama School, Identity School of Acting.
